entry.title: What Dreams May Come
entry.summary:
Author: BeBraveDearHeart

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,592Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: Between the Cailleach—who watched him silently—and the swirling darkness of the rend in the fabric of the world, sat a squat circle of stones, built up into a small wall. A well. Either Merlin had not noticed it before or, more likely, it had materialised before him without his notice. He could feel how alive this place was with magic, though none of it felt quite right at the gateway that should never have been. The hairs on the back of his neck raised, as if something had breathed down it, and Merlin shivered. It was now or never. Merlin perched himself on the edge of the wall, swinging his legs round until they dangled into nothingness. With one final glance at the men who still argued, each one of them dear to him, he caught Arthur’s eyes at last. Merlin’s heart sank in his chest, as he watched Arthur’s jaw drop. Merlin does what he must to pay the Cailleach's toll. Arthur is with him, even at the bottom of a well.

entry.title: Not Without You
entry.summary:
Author: Needsdean

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,195Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 9

Summary: It’s been three months since Arthur’s death. The kingdom tries to move on, but Merlin… he’s still stuck on the day he held Arthur in his arms, unable to accept that he’s lost him forever. His pain comes to an end when one day, unexpectedly, Arthur comes back from the waters of Avalon. Trying to solve the mystery of this sudden return, Arthur and Merlin keep protecting the kingdom from the dangers that still threaten it, like the Saxons, whose new leader is ready to conquer the throne on Morgana’s name. It seems like nothing has changed, but everything has: the secret that Merlin was so afraid to reveal to Arthur ends up bringing them even closer to each other. In a Camelot where magic is no longer banned, in a new world where he can be by Arthur’s side without hiding who he is, Merlin finds himself living a dream with the fear of waking up, happy for Arthur’s return but also terrified by the idea of losing him again. Now that secrets between them are over, and Arthur finds out Merlin has done so much more than hide his magic: to protect him he's suffered, sacrificed everything, made difficult choices. He begins to know a side of Merlin that’s new to him, and yet, that somehow he’s always known… and loved.
